text.text: Atari Handheld game console Fourth 1989 Cartridge 2 buttons joypad

text.name: sys_description
text.text: This color laptop developed by Epyx under the name 'Handy' in 1987 was marketed by Atari in 1989 after the company was acquired. This after modification of the internal speaker and removal of the stick on the pad. Equipped with a 4 Mhz processor, a 16 Mhz GPU with 3D support and 64 KB of RAM it displayed 480x102 in 16 colors. The 1991 'Lynx II' will bring a new design, a better screen and a power saving option. We could also invert the screen for left-handers and play up to 8 on the network, but it was huge and too greedy in batteries.
